medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe bronchospasm and oxygen desaturation following rapacuronium administration.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced a rapid onset of bronchospasm approximately one minute after administration of rapacuronium. Oxygen saturation decreased significantly and severe bronchospasm occurred, making ventilation difficult. Despite attempts at manual ventilation, the situation progressed to the point where O2 saturation fell as low as 70%. Treatments with bronchodilators improved ventilation and oxygenation gradually over the next 5 minutes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history included hepatitis B at the age of 13 and a history of depressive disorder. The patient was also a smoker (10 cigarettes per day).
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a smoker, consuming about 10 cigarettes per day.
